p: The essential oil of Dacryodes peruviana fruits is constituted by ~50% α-phellandrene (CAS 99-83-2), which is a cyclic monoterpene that is widespread in nature and has been identified as the main compound of several essential oils [ 18, 19, 20]. α-Phellandrene has been reported to not be genotoxic in Chinese hamster ovary cells and to promote tumor formation on the skin of mice treated with the primary carcinogen DMBA (7,12-Dimethylbenz[a]anthracene), but is not carcinogenic in its own right; this compound presents minimal risk of irritation sensitization or toxicity (acute oral toxicity in rats LD 50: 5.7 g/kg, acute dermal toxicity in rabbits LD 50: >5g/kg) [ 21]. The α-phellandrene has demonstrated antioxidant [ 22] and insecticidal activity [ 19], antihyperalgesic and antidepressive actions [ 20], and produces antinociceptive activity in rodents [ 23] and promotes immune responses in mice [ 24]. Essential oils containing α-phellandrene as one of the main compounds have shown antioxidant, repellent [ 25], antimicrobial [ 18], antiacetylcholinesterase [ 26], antihyperalgesic and antidepressive activity [ 20].
